meanings.definition: To deceive or lie to someone.
meanings.sent1: He bullshitted his way out of trouble by making up an excuse.
meanings.sent2: She always bullshitted about her achievements to impress others.
meanings.sent3: The comedian bullshitted about his imaginary pet elephant in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: Her promises were as empty as a bullshitted balloon.
meanings.sent5: The politician's words were so easily forgotten, like a bullshitted promise.

meanings.definition: To talk nonsense or make up stories.
meanings.sent1: The child bullshitted about seeing a unicorn in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: He often bullshitted about his adventures to entertain his friends.
meanings.sent3: The student bullshitted about his homework being eaten by a giant squirrel.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were as unbelievable as a bullshitted fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The conspiracy theorist's stories were as wild as a bullshitted legend.

meanings.definition: To engage in idle or frivolous talk.
meanings.sent1: They bullshitted for hours about the weather without saying anything important.
meanings.sent2: During the break, the colleagues bullshitted about their weekend plans.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends bullshitted about their dream vacation to Mars.
meanings.sent4: Her gossip was as light as a bullshitted feather.
meanings.sent5: The chatter at the party was as endless as a bullshitted conversation.
